Profile
A passionate and driven Computer Engineering graduate (final exam completed, results awaited) with 
strong programming expertise and a solid foundation in Data Science, Artificial intelligence , 
Machine Learning, and Software Development. Skilled in Python, C#, and Java with hands-on project 
experience in real-world systems such as a "Face and Iris-Based Attendance System using Python" and 
a "Salon Management System in C#". Certified in Core Java, Advanced Python, and Data Visualization. 
Known for analytical thinking, leadership as an NSS leader, and a commitment to building efficient, 
user-focused software solutions.

Projects
Face and Iris Based Attendence System
based on Deep Learning
Designed and developed a desktop-based application in Python to automate attendance tracking 
using facial and iris recognition. The system employs advanced image processing and machine 
learning algorithms for precise identification and verification. Features include real-time data 
capture, secure storage, and detailed reporting. This project showcases expertise in Python 
programming, computer vision (OpenCV), and biometric authentication systems, providing a 
reliable and efficient solution for attendance management.
Salon Management System
System Based Application
Developed a desktop-based application using C# to streamline salon operations, including 
customer management, appointment scheduling, service tracking, and billing. Designed an intuitive 
user interface for seamless navigation and integrated backend support for efficient data handling. 
The system enhanced operational efficiency, improved customer experience, and demonstrated 
proficiency in object-oriented programming and desktop application development.
IoT-Based Gas Leakage Detector
As part of my college mini project, I developed an IoT-based gas leakage detection system that uses 
an MQ6 gas sensor and an Arduino microcontroller to monitor the presence of LPG gas in the 
surrounding environment. The system was designed to detect leaks in real time and alert users, 
helping to prevent hazards such as explosions and health risks. A simple Java-based frontend was 
used for user interaction, while the backend logic and data handling were managed through 
Arduino. This project demonstrates practical skills in embedded systems, sensor integration, and 
safety automation, with applications in home safety, industrial gas pipelines, and CNG automobile 
systems. It is also scalable for future integration into smart homes and IoT-enabled environments.
